alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 1:57AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MDT/8 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, Dundy and Hitchcock. * WHEN...Until 700 AM MDT Tuesday /800 AM CDT Tuesday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 AM MDT /150 AM CDT/, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area on Highway 61 and several country roads. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Max. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
